decks.notes: The deck focuses on using the life total as a resource to build a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By playing low-cost, high-power creatures like Death's Shadow and combining them with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the board, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain tempo advantage. The inclusion of interaction and disruption spells like Daze and Stubborn Denial allows the deck to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also using reanimation spells like Reanimate to efficiently bring back key creatures from the graveyard.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with land destruction while establishing a board presence with efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Mother of Runes. The deck also aims to utilize Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play at instant speed and to toolbox with Recruiter of the Guard. Furthermore, the deck utilizes powerful equipment like Swords of Plowshares and Jitte to gain advantage in combat situations. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive disruption to control the game tempo and ultimately out-value the opponent.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Flickerwisp to control the opponent's board while applying pressure. It also utilizes powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance the creatures' effectiveness in combat. Cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port are used to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Mother of Runes and Recruiter of the Guard provide additional protection and utility. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game with efficient creatures and equipment.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By using these combo pieces alongside cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce for protection, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with game-ending threats early in the game. With the ability to generate massive advantage through these cheat mechanics, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to establish their own game plan.

The main theme of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Hymn to Tourach and using versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to gain card advantage and control the board. Along with countermagic like Force of Will, the deck includes threats like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Gurmag Angler to pressure the opponent. The deck's mana base includes a variety of dual lands to support the deck's 4/5 color control strategy.

The main focus of this Control - Stoneblade deck is to establish control over the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying powerful threats. It utilizes cards like Force of Will, Brainstorm, and Swords to Plowshares for disruption, alongside efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis for pressure. The inclusion of Jace, the Mind Sculptor offers additional card advantage and control options, while Umezawa's Jitte provides further utility. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's goals, with access to various colors and efficient land destruction with Wasteland.

This deck focuses on sacrificing creatures to generate value and deal damage using cards like Bloodghast and Carrion Feeder. The goal is to fill up the graveyard quickly with cards like Faithless Looting and Entomb, allowing you to recur creatures with abilities like Gravecrawler and Bridge from Below. With cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize for disruption, and the ability to sacrifice creatures with Goblin Bombardment, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a constant stream of threats and damage.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through cards like Cabal Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, while also digging through the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Preordain to find key pieces such as Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. The goal is to cast multiple spells in a single turn to build up storm count, then finish the opponent off with a powerful storm spell like Tendrils of Agony. Thoughtseize and Duress are included to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively and using Death's Shadow to leverage your life total as a resource. It utilizes a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the game state, while also having threats like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overpowering them with efficient creatures and spells. Additionally, the deck includes a reanimation package with Reanimate to bring back key threats from the graveyard if needed.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out artifact creatures and using cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager to pump them up and overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Phyrexian Revoker to control the board. The mana base is built around Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors for fast mana, while also utilizing Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The goal is to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan.

Utilize various card draw and filtering spells to find key combo pieces such as Entomb and Reanimate to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand. Use control elements like Force of Will and Spell Snare to protect your combo and outvalue opponents with cards like Baleful Strix. Utilize Snapcaster Mage to recast crucial spells from the graveyard and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game and dig for combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to quickly reanimate powerful creatures to overwhelm opponents and win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly lower your own life total in order to make Death's Shadow a powerful threat on the battlefield. Utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to drop Death's Shadow as early as possible for a massive creature capable of dealing significant damage. The deck also includes counterspells and removal to protect Death's Shadow and control the board, while also including cards like Reanimate to bring back key creatures if needed. The aggressive playstyle and efficient use of resources make this deck a formidable contender in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on quickly playing Death's Shadow and other aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and hand disruption. It aims to use cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to lower its own life total and power up Death's Shadow, making it a formidable threat on the battlefield. The deck also utilizes cheap removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to deal with opponent's threats, while leveraging its efficient card draw and cantrips to maintain card advantage and ensure consistent draws.

The deck is focused on quickly deploying aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets and Death's Shadow, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Stubborn Denial. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with opposing threats. The main goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game quickly with powerful threats like Gurmag Angler. Additionally, the deck includes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find the right cards at the right time.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing lands as a resource. It focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while also utilizing cards like Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes various ways to recur lands from the graveyard to ensure a steady flow of resources, while also providing ways to deal with threats and gain card advantage. The key strategy is to overload the opponent with land disruption and powerful threats to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Dark Depths combo quickly and efficiently using cards like Thespian's Stage, Crop Rotation, and Sylvan Scrying. The deck also includes disruption elements such as Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Elvish Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal provide additional mana acceleration to help execute the combo faster. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful, game-winning 20/20 Marit Lage token as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent.
